item.title: Updated Set recording and analytics flow block topic
item.description: Added information that explains how to disable Contact Lens conversational analytics. See Configuration tips in the Flow block: Set recording and analytics behavior topic.

item.title: Updated Service quotas page
item.description: Clarified how long it takes for quota increases to be processed. Corrected Scheduled reports per instance to indicate it is not adjustable. For more information, see Amazon Connect service quotas.

item.title: Added Wisdom support for Microsoft SharePoint Online
item.description: You can choose Microsoft SharePoint Online as knowledge base for Wisdom articles.

item.title: Update to Set Voice ID block
item.description: Updated the Set Voice ID block so it supports fraud watchlist ID for fraud detection.

item.title: Added Cross-channel concurrency
item.description: You can configure an agents routing profile to receive contacts from multiple channels at the same time. For example, while an agent is on a voice contact, they can be offered contacts from any other channels enabled in the routing profile, such as chats and tasks. For more information, see Create a routing profile. Also see the CrossChannelBehavior API.

item.title: Search, sort, and filter published agent schedules
item.description: Schedulers can quickly search, sort, and filter agent schedules from within the published schedule calendar. For more information, see Search and sort a schedule.

item.title: Added staff level shift profile
item.description: You can assign a shift profile to individual agents. This is useful to do when, for example, you have part-time agents who are in the same staffing group as your full-time agents, but they require their own shift profile. For more information, see the Associate to shift profile option described in Create staff rules for scheduling.

item.title: Updated Set up outbound caller ID
item.description: As of March 31, 2023, Amazon Connect no longer sets CNAM configurations. For more information, see CNAM in the Set up outbound caller ID topic.

item.title: Create step-by-step guides for your agents
item.description: Inside the out-of-the-box Amazon Connect agent workspace, you can create workflows that walk agents through custom UI pages that suggest what to do at a given moment during a customer interaction. You can create guides that help agents identify customer issues and recommend subsequent actions, as well as surface screen-pops and forms for submitting transactions and disposition codes. For more information, see Agent Workspace guided experience.

item.title: Added support for nested JSON in Invoke AWS Lambda function flow block
item.description: The Invoke AWS Lambda function flow block supports JSON responses. For more information, see Flow block: Invoke AWS Lambda function.

item.title: Added support for multiple fraudster watchlists
item.description: Every domain has a default watchlist where all existing fraudsters are placed by default. You can create and manage custom watchlists to be evaluated against for known fraudster detection. For more information, see Known fraudster detection, and see new actions in the Amazon Connect Voice ID API Reference.

item.title: Added Show View flow block
item.description: This block is used to configure UI based workflows that you can surface to users in front end applications. For more information, see Flow block: Show view.

item.title: Search and sort schedules in the Schedule Manager
item.description: Schedulers can quickly search for schedule names using partial keywords or sort the schedule list based on start date, end date, creation date, or updated date. For more information, see Search and sort a schedule.

item.title: Configure multiple IAM roles that can be assigned to a single user when using SAML 2.0
item.description: You can configure multiple IAM roles that can be assigned to a single user when using SAML 2.0 which enables you to support user access from multiple identity providers simultaneously. For example, if you are migrating identity providers, you can configure multiple IAM roles associated to a single user and that user will be able to access Amazon Connect from either provider. To learn more about configuring IAM roles for SAML 2.0 in Amazon Connect, see the Configure SAML with IAM for Amazon Connect documentation.

item.title: Panel template for interactive chat messages
item.description: With a panel template, you can present customers with up to 10 choices under one question in a chat message. For more information, see Add interactive messages to chat.

item.title: Added GetMetricDataV2 API
item.description: Added the GetMetricDataV2 API to the Amazon Connect API Reference Guide. This API enables you to programmatically access trailing 14 days of historical agent and contact metrics data. It extends the capabilities of the GetMetricData API, provides new historical metrics (for example, the number of contacts disconnected, and the number of callback attempts), and provides the ability to filter metrics with more granularity.

item.title: Added permission for managing Amazon Connect Customer Profiles Service Linked Roles
item.description: Added iam:CreateServiceLinkedRole which allows you to create service-linked roles for Customer Profiles.

item.title: Updated Set up US emergency calling
item.description: Updated the steps involved in setting up US emergency calling. For more information, see Set up US emergency calling in Amazon Connect.

item.title: Added the DeleteDomain API for Cases
item.description: For more information, see the DeleteDomain API in the Amazon Connect Cases API Reference Guide.

item.title: Added new attribute type ENHANCED_CONTACT_MONITORING to Describe, List and Update Instance Attribute APIs
item.description: This release updates the APIs: DescribeInstanceAttribute, ListInstanceAttributes, and UpdateInstanceAttribute. You can use it to programmatically enable/disable enhanced contact monitoring using attribute type ENHANCED_CONTACT_MONITORING on the specified Amazon Connect instance. For more information, see DescribeInstanceAttribute, ListInstanceAttributes, and UpdateInstanceAttribute.

item.title: Added RelatedContactId to StartTaskContact API
item.description: You can link together an unlimited number of task contacts using the RelatedContactID parameter supported in the StartTaskContact API. For more information, see Linked tasks and the StartTaskContact API in the Amazon Connect API Reference Guide.

item.title: Amazon Connect Cases integrates with AWS PrivateLink
item.description: For more information, see Amazon Connect and interface VPC endpoints (AWS PrivateLink).

item.title: Added CONTACT_EVALUATIONS to ResourceType
item.description: In the Amazon Connect API Reference Guide, added CONTACT_EVALUATIONS as a valid value to the ResourceType parameter. This affects the following APIs: AssociateInstanceStorageConfig, DescribeInstanceStorageConfig, DisassociateInstanceStorageConfig, ListInstanceStorageConfig, and UpdateInstanceStorageConfig.

item.title: Added support to provide visibility into an agents next activity
item.description: You can view an agents next activity in the real-time metrics agent table in the Amazon Connect real-time metrics UI and by using the public API. For more information, see the NextStatus API reference.

item.title: Added support to provide more granular permissions to metrics reports, including new permissions for real-time metrics, historical metrics, and agent activity audit
item.description: You can configure more granular permissions to metrics and reports from within security profiles in the Amazon Connect admin website. For more information, see Permissions required to view real-time metrics reports and Agent activity audit permissions.

item.title: Added support for more granular access controls (using resource tags) to view real-time metrics for agents, queues, and routing profiles
item.description: You can enable more granular access controls for real-time metrics by configuring resource tags and access control tags within security profiles in the Amazon Connect admin website. For more information, see Real-time tag-based access control and Tag based access control in Amazon Connect.

item.title: S3 Object Lock for the call recordings bucket
item.description: You can use Amazon S3 Object Lock in combination with your call recording bucket to help prevent call recordings from being deleted or overwritten for a fixed amount of time, or indefinitely. For more information, see How to set up S3 Object Lock for immutable call recordings.

item.title: CloudFormation templates for instance management
item.description: You can use CloudFormation templates to manage Amazon Connect instances for associating Amazon Lex and Lex V2 bots, Lambda functions, security keys, and approved originsalong with the rest of your AWS infrastructurein a secure, efficient, and repeatable way. For more information, see Amazon Connect resource type reference in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

item.title: Added information about key highlights
item.description: To learn about the agent's key highlights experience in the Contact Control Panel, see Design a flow for key highlights.

item.title: Updated Concurrent post-chat analytics jobs quota
item.description: Changed Concurrent post-chat analytics jobs quota from 100 to 200. For more information, see Contact Lens service quotas.

item.title: Added persistent chat
item.description: Customers often start a chat, then leave the conversation and return later to continue chatting. This may happen many times over the course of several days, months, or even years. To support long running chats like these, you enable persistent chat. For more information, see Enable persistent chat. Also see changes to StartChatContact in the Amazon Connect API Reference Guide, and see the GetTranscript API the Amazon Connect Participant Service API Reference Guide.

item.title: Added documentation requirements Brazil, Caribbean, Iceland, and other numbers
item.description: Updated documentation requirements for Austria, France, and Japan as well. For more information, see Region requirements for ordering and porting phone numbers.

item.title: Added documentation requirements for porting Argentina numbers
item.description: For more information, see Region requirements for ordering and porting phone numbers.

item.title: Updates to GetCurrentMetricData and GetCurrentUserData
item.description: For the GetCurrentMetricData API, added support for routing profile filter, sort criteria, and grouping by routing profiles. For the GetCurrentUserData API, added support for routing profiles, user hierarchy groups, and agents as filters, and next status and agent status name. For both APIs, added ApproximateTotalCount.

item.title: Added message receipts feature for chat messages
item.description: The message receipts feature allows customers to receive Message delivered and Read receipts after they send a chat message. For more information, see Enable message Delivered and Read receipts in your chat user interface. Also see the SendEvent action, and the Item, MessageMetadata, and Receipt data types in the Amazon Connect Participant Service API Reference Guide.

item.title: Microsoft Edge Chromium support
item.description: Amazon Connect now supports Microsoft Edge Chromium. For more information about supported browsers, see Browsers supported by Amazon Connect.

item.title: Added chat timeouts for chat participants
item.description: When a chat conversation between an agent and a customer has been inactive (no messages sent) for a certain amount of time, you may want to consider a chat participant to be idle, and you may even want to automatically disconnect an agent from the chat. To set up chat timeout timers, see Set up chat timeouts for chat participants.

item.title: Updated definition of DequeueTimestamp
item.description: For the updated definition, see Contact records data model.

item.title: Amazon Connect supports JSON as a content type for chat messages
item.description: By supporting JSON as a content type, Amazon Connect provides you with a way to pass additional information over chat to provide rich personalized experiences. For example, rendering updates to a custom UI, customer-built interactive messages, language translation capabilities, and passing customer metadata to a third party bot. For more information, see StartChatContact in the Amazon Connect API Reference Guide, and SendMessage in the Amazon Connect Participant Service API Reference Guide.

item.title: Added feature availability by Region
item.description: Added Amazon Connect features (such as Agent workspace, Tasks, and Wisdom), and the Regions where they are available. For more information, see Availability of Amazon Connect services by Region.

item.title: Added topic on Amazon Connect availability by Region
item.description: For more information, see Availability of Amazon Connect services by Region.

item.title: Contact Lens granular data redaction
item.description: When you set up Contact Lens sensitive data redaction, you can choose which entities you want to redact, and how you want the redaction to appear in the transcript. For more information, see Enable redaction of sensitive data.

item.title: Released Barge to allow contact center managers to join ongoing calls
item.description: Barge allows managers to join and participate in an ongoing customer service call between a contact center agent and customer. After joining the call, a manager can speak with the customer, add participants, and even choose to remove an agent if needed. For more information, see Barge live conversations.

item.title: Additional Contact Lens language support and Region availability
item.description: Documented that Contact Lens supports the following languages: English - New Zealand, English - South Africa. It is also available in the following Regions: Africa (Cape Town), Asia Pacific (Seoul), Asia Pacific (Singapore).

item.title: Added user hierarchy to bulk user upload
item.description: You can assign the user hierarchy in the .csv file when you add users in bulk. For more information, see Add users in bulk.

item.title: Granular access controls using resource tags for users, security profiles, routing profiles, and queues
item.description: You can now enable more granular access controls for security profiles, users, routing profiles, and queues by configuring resource tags within the Amazon Connect console. You can add resource tags to filter and organize these resources logically, and configure access control tags within security profiles to enforce granular permissions. For more information, see Tagging resources in Amazon Connect and Tag based access controls in Amazon Connect.

item.title: Bulk user import now includes agent hierarchy and tags
item.description: Amazon Connect now allows you to configure hierarchies and resource tags for users in bulk. You can now assign agent hierarchies and resource tags to each agent using the CSV bulk upload template which is available on the user management page. For more information, see Tagging resources in Amazon Connect.

item.title: Rules Function language
item.description: The Rules Function language is a JSON-based representation of a series of rule conditions. Use it to programmatically add conditions to rules. For more information, see Amazon Connect Rules Function language in the Amazon Connect API Reference Guide.

item.title: Search contacts by agent's first or last name is available in AWS GovCloud
item.description: For more information, see Search contacts by agent's first or last name.

item.title: GA for Rules APIs
item.description: Released a set of Rules APIs that enable you to programmatically create and manage rules. For more information, see Rules actions in the Amazon Connect API Reference.

item.title: GA for Forecasting, scheduling, and capacity planning
item.description: Released Forecasting, scheduling, and capacity planning for General Availability. These features help you have the right number of agents working at the right times to achieve your operational goals. For more information, see Forecasting, capacity planning, and scheduling.

item.title: Create step-by-step guides for your agents
item.description: Inside the out-of-the-box Connect agent workspace, you can now create workflows that walk agents through custom UI pages that suggest what to do at a given moment during a customer interaction. You can create guides that help agents identify customer issues and recommend subsequent actions, as well as surface screen-pops and forms for submitting transactions and disposition codes. For more information, see Agent Workspace guided experience.

item.title: Contact Lens supports chat
item.description: Amazon Connect Contact Lens provides conversational analytics capabilities for Amazon Connect chat, extending the machine learning powered analytics to better assess chat contacts. For more information, see Analyze conversations using Amazon Connect Contact Lens.

item.title: Added evaluation form features to Contact Lens (Preview)
item.description: You can create evaluation forms, and then make them available to managers to review conversations along side contact details, recordings, transcripts, and summaries, without the need to switch applications. Conversational analytics automatically pre-populates evaluation scores for criteria like script adherence, sensitive data collection, and customer greetings. For more information, see Evaluate performance (Preview).

item.title: Added configurable Lex timeouts in chat
item.description: You can configure how long to wait for a response from a customer in a chatbot conversation before the session expires. For more information, see Configurable time-outs for chat input in the Get customer input topic.

item.title: Create rules that send email notifications
item.description: You can create Contact Lens rules that send email notifications to people in your organization. For more information, see Create Contact Lens rules that send email notifications.

item.title: Added MonitorContact API
item.description: Added a new API for programmatically initiating monitoring of ongoing contacts. For more information, see MonitorContact API.

item.title: Search for profiles using multiple search keys
item.description: In addition to searching for profiles with a single search key (i.e., a key-values(s) pair), the SearchProfiles API has been enhanced to support searching for profiles using multiple keys and logical operators. This new functionality allows you to use between 1 and 5 search keys with AND or OR logic to find profiles with attributes that match the search criteria.. For more information, see the SearchProfiles API reference.

item.title: Increased Cases domain quota from 2 to 5
item.description: Increased the default maximum number of Cases domains per AWS account from 2 to 5. For more information, see Amazon Connect Cases service quotas.

item.title: Added new fields to the GetFederationToken response payload
item.description: Added SignInUrl, UserArn, and UserId to the GetFederationToken response payload.

item.title: Added ability to disable case templates through the UpdateTemplate API
item.description: Disabling templates prevents users from creating cases by using the template. For more information, see the Amazon Connect Cases API Reference.

item.title: Renamed external quick connects to phone number quick connects
item.description: For more information, see Types of quick connects.

item.title: Delete quick connects using the Amazon Connect console
item.description: For more information, see Delete quick connects.

item.title: Added DismissUserContact API
item.description: Added a new API for programmatically clearing the notifications agents receive after they have missed or rejected a contact, making them eligible to be routed new contacts. This API can also be used to clear similar notifications when an agent encounters an error with accepting the contact or is handling After Contact Work. For more information, see the DismissUserContact API reference.

item.title: Added secondary email address and mobile number to user account
item.description: You can now add a secondary email address and mobile number to a user account. For more information, see Add users to Amazon Connect.

item.title: Enhanced 911 (E911)
item.description: Enhanced 911 (E911) enables location information to be sent to 911 dispatch when a 911 call is placed. In addition to connecting a user with 911 emergency services, customers in the United States can build E911 capabilities to automatically provide the caller's address information to 911 dispatchers. For more information, see Set up US emergency calling in Amazon Connect.

item.title: GA for Amazon Connect Global Resiliency
item.description: Released Amazon Connect Global Resiliency for General Availability. It enables you to provide customer service anywhere in the world with the highest reliability, performance, and efficiency, while meeting international regulatory requirements. For more information, see Set up Amazon Connect Global Resiliency.

item.title: Corrected Wisdom service quota
item.description: The originally published quota for Content per knowledge base was incorrect. Corrected the documentation to indicate the quota is 5,000.

item.title: Feature specifications for the integration association resource
item.description: For more information, see Integration association resource feature specifications.

item.title: Added Ctrl+Shift+F to search flow block titles and metadata
item.description: For more information, see the Release notes.

item.title: GA for Amazon Connect Cases
item.description: We've released Amazon Connect Cases for General Availability. Amazon Connect Cases allows your agents to quickly track and manage customer issues that require multiple interactions, follow-up tasks, and teams in your contact center. For more information, see Amazon Connect Cases and Amazon Connect Cases API Reference.

item.title: Updated flow designer
item.description: We've released a number of improvements to the flow designer experience to make building and editing flows easier. For a detailed list of changes, see Updated flow designer in the Release notes.

item.title: Search for Amazon Connect users by first name, last name, and more
item.description: You can search for Amazon Connect users by first name, last name, user login, agent hierarchy, security profile, and routing profile. For example, you can search for all Amazon Connect users who have the first name "Jane."

item.title: Visualize historical queue data
item.description: You can now visualize historical queue data by using time series graphs to help identify patterns, trends, and outliers specifically for Service Level, Contacts Queued, and Average Handle Time. For more information, see Visualize: Queue dashboard.

item.title: Voice spoofing
item.description: Use Voice ID to evaluate calls for voice spoofing. For more information, see Voice spoofing detection and the Amazon Connect Voice ID API Reference.

item.title: Released SearchSecurityProfiles API
item.description: Added a new API for programmatically searching security profiles. For more information, see SearchSecurityProfiles.

item.title: Released Schedule Adherence (Preview)
item.description: Contact center supervisors or managers track schedule adherence to understand when agents are following the schedule that you have created. This helps ensure you achieve your service level targets, while improving agent productivity and customer satisfaction. For more information, see Schedule Adherence.

item.title: Attachments per chat conversation now at 35
item.description: Updated the limit for attachments per chat conversations from 5 to 35. See Feature specifications.

item.title: Added Voice ID Flow language actions
item.description: Added topics for the following Voice ID Flow language actions: CheckOutboundCallStatus, CheckVoiceId, and StartVoiceIdStream.

item.title: Search for contacts by using the agent's first or last name
item.description: You can search for contacts using the agent's first or last name. The filter name is Agent.

item.title: Released updates for rich text format rendering
item.description: On the Contact Search and Contact Detail pages, you can now view chat transcripts that have rich text formatting, such as bold or italic font, bullet points, numbered lists, and hyperlinks. For more information about getting started with Amazon Connect Chat, see Set up your customer's chat experience.

item.title: View call transcript in CCP or agent application
item.description: For more information, see View a call transcript during ACW.

item.title: Added feature specifications for Contact Lens
item.description: For more information, see Amazon Connect Contact Lens feature specifications.

item.title: Support for Lex intent confidence scores and sentiment analysis
item.description: You can further personalize the automated self-service customer experience using Amazon Lex intent confidence scores and sentiment analysis as a branch within your flows. For more information, see the Get customer input block. For a list of new contact attributes see Amazon Lex contact attributes.

item.title: GA for Amazon Connect Outbound Campaigns
item.description: Released Amazon Connect Outbound Campaigns, formally known as High-volume outbound communications, for General Availability. This release includes a set of APIs for creating and managing outbound campaigns. For more information, see Enable Amazon Connect outbound campaigns and Amazon Connect Amazon Connect Outbound Campaigns API Reference.

item.title: Amazon Connect Cases (Preview)
item.description: Amazon Connect Cases (Preview) allows your agents to quickly track and manage customer issues that require multiple interactions, follow-up tasks, and teams in your contact center. For more information, see Amazon Connect Cases (Preview) and Amazon Connect Cases API Reference (Preview).

item.title: Updated Amazon Lex bot per instance quota
item.description: Updated the Amazon Lex bot per instance quota from 50 to 70. For more information, see Amazon Connect service quotas.

item.title: New GetCurrentUserData API
item.description: Released the GetCurrentUserData API. It enables you to return the real-time active user data from the specified Amazon Connect instance.

item.title: Released task templates
item.description: You can now create custom task templates, making it easy for agents to consistently capture the relevant and required information to create or complete tasks. For more information, see Create task templates. For information about using the API to programmatically create and manage task templates, see the Amazon Connect API Reference and the Amazon Connect Resource Type Reference in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

item.title: New API to transfer contacts
item.description: Added a new API that you can use to transfer contacts from one agent or queue to another agent or queue at any point after a contact is created. For information, see TransferContact in the Amazon Connect API Reference.

item.title: Updated workflow for outbound campaigns
item.description: Updated the workflow for onboarding to outbound campaigns using the Amazon Connect and Amazon Pinpoint user interface. For more information, see Enable outbound campaigns.

item.title: Voice ID expires speakers
item.description: For BIPA Compliance, Amazon Connect Voice ID automatically expires speakers that have not been accessed for enrollment, re-enrollment, or successful authentication for three years. You can see a speaker's last access time by looking at the lastAccessedAt attribute returned by the DescribeSpeaker and ListSpeakers APIs, and the What data is stored? section of the Amazon Connect Admin Guide.

item.title: Search Voice ID results
item.description: Added topic Search and review Voice ID results.

item.title: New API to change agent's current status
item.description: Amazon Connect provides an API to programmatically change the current status of an agent. Agent statuses are used to determine when an agent is Available to be routed contacts in Amazon Connect, versus when they are set to Offline or a custom status such as Lunch or Break and should not be routed contacts. For more information, see PutUserStatus in the Amazon Connect API Reference.

item.title: New APIs
item.description: Added API to search for user records by first name, last name, username, routing profile, security profile, agent hierarchies or tags. Added API to claim new phone numbers and configure them programmatically. For more information, see the Amazon Connect API Reference.

item.title: Multi-party calls
item.description: You can enable Amazon Connect to allow up to six parties on a call: the agent, the caller, and four more participants. For more information, including a comparison of how multi-party calling differs from the default three-party calling, see Telephony: Multi-party calls.

item.title: Play prompts from an Amazon S3 bucket
item.description: Added the ability to source prompts from an Amazon S3 bucket. This enables you to store as many voice prompts as needed in Amazon S3 and access them in real time using contact attributes in the following flow blocks that play prompts: Get customer input, Loop prompts, Play prompt, and Store customer input.

item.title: Real-time contact analysis segment streams
item.description: Added support for accessing Contact Lens analytics in near real-time. For more information, see Use streaming for real-time contact analysis.

item.title: Rich messaging for chat
item.description: Added support for rich messaging for your customer's chat experience. Agents and customers can use bold, italic, bulleted lists, numbered list, hyperlinks, and attachments. For more For more information, see Enable text formatting for your customer's chat experience.

item.title: Object type mapping user interface
item.description: Added a user interface for creating object type mapping by using the Amazon Connect admin console. For more information, see Create an object type mapping.

item.title: Updates to AmazonConnectServiceLinkedRolePolicy
item.description: Added actions for Amazon CloudWatch metrics. For more information, see Amazon Connect updates to AWS managed policies.

item.title: Added bulk ingestion of data for Customer Profiles
item.description: For more information, see Bulk ingestion of data in the Set up integration for Salesforce, ServiceNow, Marketo, or Zendesk topic.

item.title: New quotas for APIs
item.description: For StartChatContact , StartContactStreaming , StopContactStreaming , a RateLimit of 5 requests per second, and a BurstLimit of 8 requests per second.

item.title: New CloudWatch metrics for chat
item.description: Added the following Amazon CloudWatch metrics for chat: ConcurrentActiveChats, ConcurrentActiveChatsPercentage, ChatBreachingActiveChatQuota, and SuccessfulChatsPerInterval. For more information, see Monitoring your instance using CloudWatch.

item.title: Documented Rules feature specifications
item.description: Documented the feature specifications for Amazon Connect Rules. For more information, see Amazon Connect Rules feature specifications.

item.title: Documented Identity Resolution quotas
item.description: Documented three quotas for Identity Resolution. For more information, see Customer Profiles quotas.

item.title: Configure maximum chat duration
item.description: You can configure the total duration per chat to be up to 7 days, including wait time. For more information, see the ChatDurationInMinutes parameter in the StartChatContact API.

item.title: Contact Lens supports custom vocabularies
item.description: For more information, see Add custom vocabularies.

item.title: Released tagging support for UserHierarchyGroup resource
item.description: For more information, see CreateUserHierarchyGroup.

item.title: Communications widget supports browser notifications
item.description: For more information, see Browser notifications.

item.title: Integrate Customer Profiles with Segment and Shopify
item.description: For more information, see Set up integration for Segment and Set up integration for Shopify.

item.title: Updated compliance for tasks
item.description: Tasks is in compliance with GDPR, and is approved for SOC, PIC, HITRUST, ISO, and HIPAA.

item.title: Released unified agent application
item.description: Amazon Connect released the unified agent application to improve the agent experience and customer interactions. For more information, see Agent training guide.

item.title: Released key highlights
item.description: Amazon Connect Contact Lens provides the option for you to view key highlights. The key highlights show only those lines where Contact Lens has identified an issue, outcome, or action item in the transcript. For more information, see View key highlights.

item.title: Documented Average API Connecting Time
item.description: Documented the real-time metric Average API Connecting Time. For more information, see Average API Connecting Time.

item.title: Released Identity Resolution to consolidate similar profiles
item.description: Amazon Connect Customer Profiles offers Identity Resolution, a feature that is designed to automatically detect similar customer profiles by comparing name, email address, phone number, date of birth, and address. For more information, see Use Identity Resolution to consolidate similar profiles and the Amazon Connect Customer Profiles API Reference.

item.title: Updated Customer Profiles service quotas
item.description: Amazon Connect Customer Profiles now supports 1000 objects per profile (increased from 100), and 50MB Maximum size of all objects for a profile (increased from 5MB). For more information, see Amazon Connect Customer Profiles service quotas.

item.title: Amazon Connect Customer Profiles stores contact history at no charge
item.description: Amazon Connect Customer Profiles now provides contact history and customer information together in unified customer profiles at no charge, helping contact center managers personalize the contact center experience. In new instances, Customer Profiles is enabled by default. For more information, see Step 4: Data Storage in the Create an Amazon Connect instance topic.

item.title: New APIs to archive/unarchive and delete flows
item.description: Added new APIs that provide a programmatic and flexible way to manage your library of flows at scale. For example, flows used only during certain times of the year can be archived when not in use and then unarchived when needed. You can now also delete a flow so it is no longer available for use. For more information, see the Amazon Connect API Reference.

item.title: Added modular flows to help you create common functions
item.description: Flow modules are reusable sections of a flow. You can create them to extract repeatable logic across your flows, and create common functions. For more information, see Flow modules for reusable functions.

item.title: Search contacts by custom contact attributes
item.description: Added support for searching contacts by custom contact attributes (also called user-defined attributes). For more information, see Search by custom contact attributes.

item.title: Added Customer profiles block
item.description: Added the Customer profiles block. It enables you to retrieve, create, and update a customer profile.

item.title: Updated AmazonConnect_FullAccess
item.description: Added permissions for managing Amazon Connect Customer Profiles. See Amazon Connect updates to AWS managed policies.

item.title: Released security profiles APIs
item.description: Added APIs so you can create and manage security profiles programmatically. For more information, see the Amazon Connect API Reference.

item.title: Released scheduled tasks
item.description: Added the ability to schedule tasks up to six days in the future to follow-up on customer issues when promised. You can also update the scheduled date and time using the UpdateContactSchedule API. For more information, see the Create task block and the Create a task topic in the Agent training guide.

item.title: Released Contact APIs
item.description: Added APIs so you can get and update contact details programmatically. For example, you can describe contact details such as queue information, chat attachments, task references, and update contact information such as task name. For more information, see DescribeContact, UpdateContact, and ListReferences in the Amazon Connect API Reference.

item.title: Changes to real-time metrics agent tables
item.description: We are rolling out a new service to maintain the high availability from metrics that you expect from Amazon Connect. Due to this change, the agent tables are sorted by agent status instead of by agent login. Additionally, the queues and routing profiles table are sorted by agents online instead of by queue or routing profile name.

item.title: Added actions to AmazonConnectServiceLinkedRolePolicy
item.description: Added actions for Amazon Connect Customer Profiles. See Amazon Connect updates to AWS managed policies.

item.title: Added new metrics
item.description: Added following new historical metrics: Contacts transferred in by agent and Contacts transferred out by agent. Added new real-time metrics: Transferred in by agent and Transferred out by agent. See Historical metrics definitions and Real-time metrics definitions.

item.title: Released real-time chat message streaming
item.description: You can subscribe to a real-time stream of chat messages. For more information, see Enable real-time chat message streaming.

item.title: Cross-service confused deputy prevention for Customer Profiles
item.description: Updated Cross-service confused deputy prevention with more sample policies you can apply for Amazon Connect Customer Profiles.

item.title: GA for HoursOfOperation APIs
item.description: Released the Amazon Connect HoursOfOperation APIs for general availability (GA). Also launched AWS CloudFormation support for Users, User Hierarchies, and Hours of Operation. For more information, see the Amazon Connect API Reference and the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

item.title: Example: Programmatically integrate S3 with Customer Profiles
item.description: Added a topic that shows how to programmatically integrate S3 with Customer Profiles.

item.title: Cross-service confused deputy prevention
item.description: Added a topic with example policies you can apply for Cross-service confused deputy prevention.

item.title: How long unanswered callbacks stay in queue
item.description: In the Set up queued callback topic, clarified that unanswered queued callbacks stay in queue at least 7 days and up to 14 days before Amazon Connect automatically removes them.

item.title: Updated endpoint for client-side metrics
item.description: In the Set up your network topic, changed the endpoint for client-side metrics from *.execute-api.{region}.amazonaws.com to *.telemetry.connect.{region}.amazonaws.com.

item.title: Corrected errors in Service quota topic
item.description: Corrected errors in the Service quotas topic: For Amazon Connect Wisdom, Maximum size per document is 1MB not 10MB. For Amazon Connect Customer Profiles, the name of the quota is Object Types per domain not Objects per domain. Updated the Amazon Connect Voice ID quotas table with correct information.

item.title: Preview release of outbound campaigns
item.description: Added content for the preview release of outbound campaigns. By using Amazon Pinpoint Journeys and Amazon Connect, you can now create outbound campaigns for voice, SMS, and email. For more information, see Enable outbound campaigns.

item.title: New Amazon AppIntegrations Service APIs
item.description: New DataIntegration APIs for the Amazon AppIntegrations Service: CreateDataIntegration, DeleteDataIntegration, GetDataIntegration, ListDataIntegrationAssociations, ListDataIntegrations, UpdateDataIntegration. For more information, see Amazon AppIntegrations Service API Reference.

item.title: Amazon Connect Wisdom - General Availability
item.description: In November 2023 we released Amazon Q. It includes real-time agent assist functionality formerly known as Amazon Connect Wisdom, along with generative AI-powered recommended responses, actions, and links to more information.

item.title: Amazon Connect Voice ID - General Availability
item.description: For more information, see Use real-time caller authentication with Voice ID and the Amazon Connect Voice ID API Reference.

item.title: Added new service-linked role policy
item.description: Added AmazonConnectVoiceIDFullAccess. Use this AWS managed policy so you can set up your users to use Voice ID. This policy provides full access to Amazon Connect Voice ID through the AWS console, SDK, or other means. For more information, see AWS managed policy: AmazonConnectVoiceIDFullAccess.

item.title: Added new service-linked role policy
item.description: Added AmazonConnectCampaignsServiceLinkedRolePolicy, a new service-linked role policy for outbound campaigns. The policy provides access to retrieve all the outbound campaigns. For more information, see Enable outbound campaigns.

item.title: Display name and contact attributes in chat
item.description: You can now personalize the chat experience, as you can specify the name of your customer that interacts using the chat user interface. You can also securely pass the contact attributes to capture information about the contact which can be used in the flow to further personalize the experience. For more information, see Pass the customer display name when a chat initializes and Pass contact attributes when a chat initializes.

item.title: Preview of agent application
item.description: Launched an updated UI for the agent application preview that combines Customer Profiles and the Contact Control Panel (CCP). For more information, see Access Customer Profiles in the agent application.

item.title: Added Create task block
item.description: Added the Create task block. It creates a new task, sets the tasks attributes, and initiates a flow to start the task. For more information, see Flow block: Create task.

item.title: More languages for Contact Lens
item.description: Contact Lens now supports the following languages for post-call and real-time analytics: Japanese, Korean, and Mandarin. The following languages are supported for real-time analytics: French (Canada), French (France), Portuguese (Brazil), German (Germany), and Italian (Italy). For more information, see Contact Lens for Amazon Connect in the Languages supported by Amazon Connect topic.

item.title: Updated historical metrics definitions
item.description: Updated the definitions of Contacts transferred in and Contacts transferred out. For more information, see Historical metrics definitions.

item.title: Improved user interface for Amazon Connect console
item.description: Released a redesigned user interface for the Amazon Connect console, making it easier and faster to manage Amazon Connect instances. For more information, see Create an Amazon Connect instance.

item.title: Customer Profiles is HIPAA compliant
item.description: Customer Profiles is now HIPAA compliant. Removed note stating it is not.

item.title: Porting numbers in Singapore
item.description: Updated documentation requirements. For more information, see Singapore in the Region requirements for ordering and porting phone numbers topic.

item.title: APIs for hours of operation and agent status
item.description: Released for ungated preview new APIs for managing hours of operation and agent status. For more information, see Amazon Connect Service API Reference.

item.title: Contant Lens rules create tasks and EventBridge events
item.description: Contact Lens rules now allow you to generate tasks and EventBridge events based on uttered keywords, sentiment scores, customer attributes, and other criteria. For more information, see Build rule with Contact Lens.

item.title: Countries you can call by default
item.description: We have updated the list of countries you can call by default when you create a new instance in a given Region. For more information, see Countries you can call.

item.title: Add AWS Global Accelerator to your allowlist
item.description: When using SAML Sign-In to your Amazon Connect instance, you now need to add the AWS Global Accelerator domain, *. awsglobalaccelerator.com, to your allowlist. For more information, see Set up your network.

item.title: New "Next status" feature
item.description: To help agents manage their time, we have released a feature that lets agents pause new contacts being routed to them while they finish their current contacts. For more information, see "Next status" feature for the CCP.

item.title: Update to Contact search functionality
item.description: To use the Agent filter on the Contact search page, in your Amazon Connect security profile you must have Users - View permissions. For more information, see Contact search: To search contacts by Agent login requires Users - View permissions in your security profile.

item.title: Added two task metrics sent to CloudWatch
item.description: Amazon Connect sends the following two new metrics to CloudWatch: ConcurrentTasks and ConcurrentTasksPercentage. For more information, see Monitoring your instance using CloudWatch.

item.title: Updated required permissions for custom IAM policies
item.description: Added permissions for Amazon Lex. For more information, see Amazon Connect updates to AWS managed policies.

item.title: Apple Messages for Business GA
item.description: Released Apple Messages for Business for general availability (GA). For more information, see Enable Apple Messages for Business.

item.title: Quick connects management API GA
item.description: Released Amazon Connect quick connects management API for general availability (GA). For more information, see Amazon Connect Service API Reference. The quick connects API also supports AWS CloudFormation. For more information, see Amazon Connect Resource Type Reference in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

item.title: Added service quota for Amazon Lex V2 bot aliases per instance = 100
item.description: For more information about service quotas, see Amazon Connect service quotas.

item.title: Support for Amazon Lex V2 console and APIs
item.description: For information on using the Amazon Lex V2 console, see Add an Amazon Lex bot. Added these three APIs: AssociateLexBot, DisassociateLexBot, and ListLexBots. See the Amazon Connect Service API Reference.

item.title: Coming soon: Faster load times for Real-time metrics page
item.description: Rollout to all Regions July 19, 2021, to September 19, 2021, subject to change. For more information, see Upcoming change: Faster reload times for the Real-time metrics page.

item.title: Coming soon: New DataIntegration APIs
item.description: On May 20, 2021, we published that new DataIntegration APIs were added to the Amazon AppIntegrations service. These APIs are not yet available.

item.title: Chat agent concurrency increased
item.description: Increased chat agent concurrency from 5 to 10. For more information, see Create a routing profile.

item.title: Object type mapping for Customer Profiles
item.description: Added object type mapping for the Customer Profiles standard profile. For more information, see the Object type mapping for the standard profile.

item.title: Channels supported by blocks
item.description: Added a topic that lists all the blocks and which channels each one supports. For more information, see the Channels each block supports.

item.title: Added contact events
item.description: For more information, see the Amazon Connect contact events.

item.title: Announced upcoming change to Agent audit report
item.description: In a future release, you'll be able to download the Agent audit report. For more information, see the Upcoming changes: Download the Agent audit report.

item.title: Added identity resolution APIs (preview) to Customer Profiles.
item.description: For more information, see the GetMatches and MergeProfiles APIs in the Amazon Connect Customer Profiles API reference.

item.title: Added topic on how to apply permissions that restrict which AWS resources can be associated with Amazon Connect.
item.description: For more information, see Restrict AWS resources that can be associated with Amazon Connect.

item.title: Added chapter on architectural guidance, authored by AWS Solution Architects
item.description: For more information, see Architectural guidance for Amazon Connect.

item.title: Announced upcoming fix to agent event stream
item.description: For more information, see Upcoming change: Fix for agent event stream.

item.title: Revised the topics on porting phone numbers
item.description: For more information, see Port your phone number.

item.title: Using Customer Profiles with CCP out-of-the-box is in ungated preview
item.description: For more information, see Access the Customer Profiles Agent UI.

item.title: Announced upcoming changes for Contact search
item.description: For more information, see Upcoming changes: Contact search.

item.title: Added NLB endpoint for Canada (Central) Region
item.description: Updated Set up your network with the NLB endpoint for Canada (Central) Region.

item.title: Amazon Connect is now available in the Canada (Central) Region
item.description: You can claim toll-free and local telephone numbers from Canadian telephony suppliers. For a list of countries that support the Canada (Central) Region, see Region requirements for phone numbers. Also see Availability of Contact Lens features by Region.

item.title: Announced upcoming fixes for chat metrics
item.description: Currently Amazon Connect incorrectly reports that chat contacts that were created from disconnect flows were created from transfer flows. When the fixes are released, Amazon Connect will correctly reflect in the contact records and agent event stream that these chat contacts were created from disconnect flows. For more information, see Upcoming change: Fixes for chat metrics in the Release notes.

item.title: Completed release of new domain name
item.description: The domain for the Amazon Connect access URL has changed to my.connect.aws. For more information, see March 2021 Updates in the Release notes.

item.title: Default service quota for reports per instance
item.description: Updated the default service quota for reports per instance to 2000. This default applies to accounts created in October, 2020 or later. For more information, see Amazon Connect service quotas.

item.title: Identification requirements for ordering and porting phone numbers
item.description: Added identification requirements for ordering phone numbers. Added requirements for ordering and porting phone numbers from Argentina, Chile, Mexico, Peru, and Puerto Rico. For more information, see Region requirements for phone numbers.

item.title: Use the Amazon Connect Endpoint Test Utility
item.description: To help you validate connectivity to Amazon Connect, or troubleshoot when your agents are experiencing problems with the Contact Control Panel (CCP), we added the Amazon Connect Endpoint Test Utility. For more information, see Use the Endpoint Test Utility.

item.title: Add a chat user interface to your website.
item.description: Added a communications widget that you can customize and add to your website. Also provided an open source example to help you get started with adding chat to your website. For more information, see Set up your customer's chat experience.

item.title: Content Lens real-time analytics is available in Europe (London), Europe (Frankfurt), and Asia (Tokyo).
item.description: For more information, see Availability of Contact Lens features by Region.

item.title: Added ability to create and ingest data into Customer Profiles from Amazon S3
item.description: For more information, see Create and ingest data into Customer Profiles from Amazon S3.

item.title: Added DisconnectReason to the contact record stream
item.description: The Amazon Connect contact records stream now includes DisconnectReason for voice calls and tasks. For more information, see ContactTraceRecord.

item.title: Added custom service levels
item.description: Added the ability to create custom service levels, and update the metrics user interface. For details, see New metric groups and categories.

item.title: Queue APIs (Preview)
item.description: Added APIs so you can programmatically create and manage queues. Queue APIs (Preview).

item.title: Amazon AppIntegrations APIs - GA
item.description: Released Amazon AppIntegrations APIs for general availability (GA). For more information, see Amazon AppIntegrations APIs - GA.

item.title: New Contact search page
item.description: Updated the Contact search page. For more information, see Search for contacts.

item.title: Amazon Connect Service API Reference
item.description: Added APIs so you can programmatically create and manage quick connects. For more information, see Amazon Connect Service API Reference.

item.title: Chat: Support for sharing attachments
item.description: Added support for sharing chat attachments. For more information, see Chat: Support for attachments.

item.title: Configurable DTMF timeouts for Lex bots
item.description: Added support for configurable DTMF timeouts for Lex bots. For more information, see Configurable DTMF timeouts for Lex bots.

item.title: Amazon Connect with Apple Messages for Business (Preview)
item.description: Added support for using Amazon Connect with Apple Messages for Business. For more information, see Amazon Connect with Apple Messages for Business (Preview)

item.title: Tasks
item.description: Added support for tasks, allowing you to prioritize, assign, track, and even automate tasks across the disparate tools agents use to support customers. For more information, see Tasks.

item.title: Real-time analytics using Contact Lens for Amazon Connect
item.description: Added real-time analytics for Contact Lens so you can detect and resolve customer issues more proactively while the call is in progress. For more information, see Analyze Conversations with Contact Lens for Amazon Connect.

item.title: Amazon Connect Wisdom (Preview)
item.description: In November 2023 we released Amazon Q. It includes real-time agent assist functionality formerly known as Amazon Connect Wisdom, along with generative AI-powered recommended responses, actions, and links to more information.

item.title: Amazon Connect Voice ID (Preview)
item.description: Added Amazon Connect Voice ID (Preview), which provides for real-time caller authentication. For more information, see Amazon Connect Voice ID (Preview).

item.title: Amazon Connect Customer Profiles
item.description: Added Amazon Connect Customer Profiles, enabling agents to create a customer profile for every new contact that comes in. You can also integrate with external applications that provide customer profile data. For more information, see Amazon Connect APIs.

item.title: Amazon Connect APIs
item.description: Added an Amazon Connect API that provides the ability to create tasks (StartTaskContact), and added a set of preview APIs. For more information, see Amazon Connect APIs.

item.title: Amazon Connect supports interact messages for chat
item.description: Added interactive message templates. For more information, see Add interactive messages to chat.

item.title: Telephony call metadata attributes
item.description: Added call attributes to improve fraud detection and routing. For more information, see Telephony call metadata attributes (call attributes).

item.title: APIs to manage user hierarchies
item.description: Added APIs so you can programmatically manage your agent hierarchies and agent groups. For more information, see Amazon Connect Service API Reference.

item.title: Service quotas
item.description: Noted that up to 700 quick connects can be added to a queue. See Feature specifications. (This update was published erroneously and has since been removed.)

item.title: Security
item.description: Added new topic on Required permissions for managing access to the Amazon Connect console.

item.title: Quick filters
item.description: Added new topic that explains how to use quick filters in real-time metrics reports. For more information, see Use quick filters to drill into Routing profiles and Queues tables.

item.title: Service quotas
item.description: Updated the service quotas for the following Amazon Connect Participant Service APIs: CreateParticipantConnection, DisconnectParticipant, and GetTranscript. For more information, see Amazon Connect Participant Service API throttling quotas.

item.title: Show agent queues in a Queues table.
item.description: By default, agent queues don't appear in a Queues table in a historical metrics report. You can choose to show them. For more information, see Show agent queues in a Queues table.

item.title: Migrate contact flows to a different instance
item.description: You can migrate hundreds of flows using a set of flow APIs. For more information, see Migrate contact flows to a different instance.

item.title: Languages supported by Amazon Connect
item.description: Learn about which languages are supported in the Amazon Connect console, Contact Control Panel, Contact Lens, Amazon Lex, and Amazon Polly. For more information, see Languages supported by Amazon Connect.

item.title: Amazon Connect Flow language
item.description: You can use the Amazon Connect Flow language to efficiently update flows that you're migrating from one instance to another, and Write flows rather than drag blocks onto the flow designer. For more information, see Amazon Connect Flow language in the Amazon Connect API Reference Guide.

item.title: Option 2 (not recommended): Allow IP address ranges
item.description: Removed tip from Option 2: Allow IP address ranges, that said if you don't see an entry for your region, use GLOBAL. For more information, see Option 2 (not recommended): Allow IP address ranges.

item.title: Option 1 (recommended): Replace Amazon EC2 and CloudFront IP range requirements with a domain allowlist
item.description: Updated Option 1, second row of table, with a line break between {myInstanceName}.awsapps.com/connect/api and *.cloudfront.net. For more information, see Option 1 (recommended): Replace Amazon EC2 and CloudFront IP range requirements with a domain allowlist.

item.title: Amazon Connect resource-level policy examples
item.description: Changed title of "Amazon Connect resource-based policy examples" topic to "Amazon Connect resource-level policy examples." For more information, see Amazon Connect resource-level policy examples.
